Miaoli is the home to Hakka culture in Taiwan.  Hakka cuisine and language differ from other parts of Taiwan.
on the Sun-Yat Sen Expressway (中山高).  The interchange is located to the south of the city.
Miaoli is served by intercity buses from
.  The bus terminal is located next to the train station in the middle of Miaoli.
Taiwan's Mountain Line passes through Miaoli.  Due to being the home of the county government, most express trains (自強號) stop at Miaoli station.
Due to Miaoli's small size, buses run throughout the county but none specifically within Miaoli.  Taxis can be found right outside the train station.

value: (王府大飯店) is located near the train station.  Simply turn left immediately after leaving the station, walk 50 meters and the hotel will be on your right.

(栗華大飯店) is a little farther away.  If unfamiliar with Miaoli, perhaps a quick taxi trip for under NT100 is preferable to getting lost.  It is located on the corner of ZhongHua Road (中華路) and YiMin Street (義民街).  The hotel has a restaurant on its first floor.
